title: manager
job_overview:
1. Handling Customer Requests:

   Receiving incoming calls, emails, and online service requests.
   Clarifying issue details, address, and preferred visit time.

2. Coordinating Technician Schedules:

    Planning and dispatching service technicians.
    Ensuring timely arrivals and job completion.

3. Managing Customer and Repair Records:

   Maintaining client profiles and repair history.
   Keeping track of spare parts inventory and completed jobs.

4. Quoting and Approving Repairs:

    Calculating repair costs based on price lists.
    Preparing estimates and invoices for clients.

5. Supplier Communication and Parts Ordering:

   Sourcing and ordering original or compatible parts.
   Monitoring delivery times and keeping clients updated.

6. Quality Control and Feedback Collection:

   Gathering feedback after service completion.
    Addressing complaints and resolving issues when needed.

7. Reporting and Analytics:

    Generating weekly and monthly reports on revenue, job volume, and repair types.
    Analyzing repeat issues and optimizing service processes.

8. Automation and AI Tool Integration (if applicable):

    Working with CRM systems, Make, Twilio, Google Sheets.
   Assisting with the implementation of voice or chatbots for initial client contact.
